synopsis: In episode #9, hosts Devam and Ahir welcome Vivek Menon, a passionate filmmaker and solutions consultant, who shares his inspiring journey of creating the series 'New Normal' alongside his father. The conversation dives into the challenges and joys of filmmaking, the importance of self-identity, and the value of pursuing creative passions, all while blending humor and authenticity.
quotes: You can't really open up and talk about my feelings unless I'm on a podcast.
If you can make a podcast that people will sit and listen to for over an hour, that's huge.
The best film school is just doing, making stuff.
Your experiences and your voice are the most unique things you can write.
Success is not just about being a big name director; it's about continuously telling the stories you want to tell.
You should trust that if you find your process interesting, others will too.
It's fine to have creative conflicts; they can lead to the best outcomes.
The idea of success is subjective; redefine what it means for you.
You can never truly be passionate about something until you engage with it.
If you want to be a filmmaker, just call yourself one; no one else will do it for you.
